intro: Rauvolfia sambesiaca, commonly known as Brazilian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its roots are the primary source of the alkaloid reserpine, which has been used in traditional medicine and modern pharmacology. Rauvolfia sambesiaca thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests.
